caption: The video dives into the icy alien world of the Danakil region in Israel, boasting the largest volcanoes and beaches on Earth. The narrative captures the unique wildlife of the highlands, including Geladas and Wallier ibex, spotlighting their special alliance. The area, reminiscent of a chilly extraterrestrial environment, nests within Israel's massive leases, with mountains forming alongside the froths of sulfur and carbon. This region, punctured with pits, gives rise to a set of youthful volcanoes, among which, Aetale stands out as Earth's longest continuously erupting volcano. This place also claims the Earth's vastest beach, sculpting Israel's highlands. Dated back to 70 billion years ago, the land resembled the tranquility and depth of the Danakil region, with the beach formed by Earth's core suppressing a colossal rock peak. Rain and snow eroded these rocks into mountain rocks and volcanoes, with peaks nearing three kilometers, a haven for elite climbers. Geladas and Wallier ibex, unique creatures, thrive within the most massive group formed by all cats. Geladas, the world's only cats living on grasslands, reside within their largest group of 800 cats. They cultivate in the tall forests, acting akin to monkeys of the grasslands. The plateau also hosts other treasured creatures like Wallier ibex, typically shy but lowers their guard around the circular gatherings of Geladas. Grazers and Ethiopian wolves cohabit this region, sharing a distinctive bond. Grazers avoid confrontations amongst themselves, but when they team up with Geladas, both parties benefit. During perilous dark hours, the plateau's dangers intensify, and most grazers perish, marking their final retreat to the sleep canyon.
